fields.summary: Option to exclude Resolved/Closed Jira issues from showing up
Add Team Calendars Support for JIRA Studio and Confluence/JIRA hosted
Allow lables to be associated with an event (team event)
Refreshing the My Calendars page does not refresh calendar contents
Team Calendars Macro - add option to not show weekends
For month view macros with lots of events that require scrolling, clicking on "Today" doesn't move the browser position to jump to today

fields.description: The add/update event methods do not need to accept the sub-calendar parameter
fields.summary: Simplify CalendarManager
Time Line view for Calendars
Approval capability for managers with Calendar.
"where" information not easily accessible
Only show one OAuth dance prompt if the calendars are from the same server
Move Upcoming Events View to RHS of Dashboard
Use relative URLs to prevent not found links/content
Event Edit Restriction to only the event creator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51258].
  {panel}

When you subscribe to an external calendar URL, the "Subscribe" button is smart enough to say "Subscribing" when you paste the URL..

We should make some UX improvements to this:

# It should say "Subscribing..." 
# The button should be disabled when it is attempting to subscribe

If the URL is invalid, the button gets enabled again and it says "Subscribe" (which is fine now).
If the URL is valid it closes the dialog (which is fine now).
fields.summary: Subscribing to a calendar button should be disabled and have "..." when subscribing
Event Delete Restriction

fields.description: Many people use Outlook to view/manage their personal calendars and want to view Team Calendars information alongside their personal Outlook calendar.
fields.summary: Ability to view one or more Team Calendars from Outlook

fields.description: Would be a great thing to be able to display the "Upcoming Events" of Team Calender also on other pages, not only on the dashboard. Using the current macro to display a team calender on a page does not like that good and is not as streamlined. (see attachment)
fields.summary: Upcoming Events Plug-in for Team Calender
Piggy back Confluence development license
Allow a page viewer to change calendar views
Singular wording for deleting a calendar with one subscriber
Improve calendar loading speed - calendars gets much slower with more events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51245].
  {panel}

Hi,

Team calendar should also have functionality like permission scheme.
As currently, the events added to the team calendar can be deleted by anybody.

Permission schemes will definitely prevent this wrongful activity.
fields.summary: Adding Permission Schemes to Team calendar plugin

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51244].
  {panel}

I'm currently in three teams:
1. PM Team
2. Cross-product team
3. Team Calendars team

Each team has a leave and travel calendar. 

When I go on leave, I enter my event three times to communicate it to those teams. Ideally, we should find a way to add an event and select multiple calendars.
fields.summary: Ability to add one event to multiple calendars
Help prevent accidental calendar deletes

fields.description:
Hi is it possible to switch date format when viewing calendar items in list view, we currently see the date format to be month/day and would like the option to see it in day/month as well.

Please advise if there is a configuration option that can change this for us.
fields.summary: Date format in list view

fields.description: Currently there's no way for me to detect changes on a calendar. Like on jira issues or on confluence pages, I'd like to subscribe to changes on a calendar. In consequence, I'd like to the new/edited events on the confluence dashboard.
fields.summary: Watch changes of an calendar.
direct display of field summary
Copy and Paste calendar entries from one month to another

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51236].
  {panel}

h3.Currently on Team Calendars, each time you try to import an .ics file it will create a new calendar on the fly.

The expected behavior would be to add/merge with the current created calendar.

h3.Workaround
# Have a Google Account.
# Log into your Calendar, Settings
# And then select "Import Calendar"
# Then start merging all calendars you'd like to add.
# When finished Export this ics
# Import in Team Calendars
fields.summary: Allow ability to merge .ics files into a single Calendar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51235].
  {panel}

Original Request:
I want to be able to set a keyword filter, to display only certain events of a Team Calendar on a Confluence page. But it is not feasible to create multiple Calendars because it will be a maintenance nightmare.
Perhaps when you add the gadget, one of the fields can let you filter by keyword.

Related:
Another option would be to consider introducing "Event" types and allowing users to make their own events and filter by the event types. This overlaps with TEAMCAL-523 quite a bit.
fields.summary: Ability to categorise events (e.g by label) and filter calendars for specific labels
Compatibility with Confluence Quick Comment

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51232].
  {panel}

Currently Team Calendars does not support Microsoft Exchange Timezone format like:
* Central Standard Time
* Central Time (US & Canada)

Here is a full list of the names used by Microsoft.

* [Time Zone|http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc749073%28v=ws.10%29.aspx]

fields.summary: Support Microsoft Exchange Timezone format.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51227].
  {panel}

I think your implementation of "people" calendars could be improved if:
- consider people as resources with availability. (similar to cars, meeting rooms, laptops...except that those resources blindly accept requests, where people to varying degrees (dependent on how empowered they are in their workplace) manage their own commitments and availability.
- each user has their own personal calendar.
- calendar items sync across multiple calendar views (events, team, personal...)
- a team calendar is not about adding things to the current people calendar...but about a user sharing their personal calendar (controls needed about sharing details of events in personal calendar - i.e. I'll share I have a meeting..but not share a sensitive medical appointment...but availability should still be blocked out.) Users are added to the team calendar and availability/calendar items flow across.
-events (such as a meeting) allow aggregation of multiple users into one item on a team calendar

Initial key here is that every user gets a personal calendar...adn the people calendars become about adding people...not people adding personal events...they add those in their personal calendar and may choose to sync with iCAL or Exchange.
fields.summary: People are resources: every users should have a personal calendar - team calendars should be about an aggregated view of personal calendars
Replace link to "Close" with button like "OK" and "Delete"

fields.description:
Right now email notifications for repeating events just say "this is a repeating event" and then show the date of the first occurrence. The notification would ideally say more than "this is a repeating event." Ideally it would also show:
* *Repeat frequency* - If it repeats daily, every weekday, weekly, monthly or yearly
* *Repeat interval* - e.g. every 2 weeks, every 1 month, etc.
* *End date* - when it stops repeating. 

Some examples:
* This event repeats every day through July 27, 2011
* This event repeats every weekday through August 12, 2011
* This event repeats every 2 weeks through December 31, 2011
* This event repeats every 3 days through October 21, 2011
fields.summary: User wants more information on recurring events within email notifications

fields.description:
When you delete a repeating event you get the option to delete all events or all future event in the series.

When editing a repeating event you should also get the same prompt.

I specifically noticed this with people calendars...if you change a person in a people calendar you'd expect to do it for future occurrences.

!https://skitch.com/barconati/fe2s7/team-calendars-confluence!

fields.description: We are looking for an integrated calendar solution which will hold our JIRA issues along with dates from external systems so that there is a single, unified calendar view of our team. Not sure on how the solution would look yet but one idea is be able to configure the calendar to add external data sources such as a REST service. To make that work it may require that those external services always come back in some sort of standard format. Then when a user goes to a calendar a call is made to all external systems configured while passing an array of users to include. This would make it the external system's responsibility to map the users if need be.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51201].
  {panel}

We've recently installed TeamCal 1.9.1, and noticed that when adding a new Jira calendar from our primary Jira instance, the UI can appear to be frozen.
After a certain period of time the UI becomes usable, and date and time fields appear from Jira in a list.

When using Chrome developer tools to see what was happening during the quiet period, it became clear that TeamCal was retrieving the Jira information.
This appeared to be in the form of a file called options.JSON

For larger Confluence/Jira instances like ours, it's important that if an operation takes longer than say 1/2 secs, there should be an indication that something is happening.
In this case, some form of dialog or spinner should be added to the "New Jira Calendar" dialog box until everything has loaded and the user can actually use the form.

Furthermore, when switching between the "Project" and "Saved Filter" radio button, there can be a few seconds lag. I think this is more of a client side rendering issue, but again it's possible for the user to see a spinner while the browser is doing it's thing, and disappearing when the dialog box is ready for use again.
fields.summary: Improve visual feedback when New Jira  Calendar dialog is communicating with Jira in the background

Here is the reproduction procedure: 
# Create a new calendar called "test" with the admin user account.

It looks like a name display issue.

This issue is to track the general ability to create team rosters. This would include the following stories:

* As a roster owner, I can define a team/list of people that are in the roster
* Team Calendars can automatically generate a roster for me based on some rules
(e.g Duration of roster period, frequency) 
* Nice-to-have Ability to define roster roles (primary support contact, stand-buy contact) etc... for each person.


... there is a lot we could do here, if you are interested in this feature please comment below and share what specific part of this feature is the biggest pain point for you? If we could solve one of these problems what would it be? What is the most painful part about organising a roster?
Cheers, 
Team Calendars team

Customer Feedback from Pieter:
{code}
Good day,

I would like to use the Team Calendars to automate our standby process. 
The current process involves a Excel spreadsheet macro where the macro automatically fills in the next team member on standby (it iterates through a list of available members). It also flags the standby as a problem if there is a conflicting task such as leave.

Note:
- There can be different sets of groups consisting of the same people
- You can specify which group of people is active from which period onwards
- The calendar can have different sets of standby's (qa, live, south africa, namibia etc) which can use a group of people.

Please do ask me if you have any questions. I've attached an example which might assist.

Thanks!
  Pieter
{code}

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51155].
  {panel}

In certain situations where event information is sensitive, it may be preferable that users can see if someone is free/busy, without knowing exactly what is keeping them busy.
This type of situation is supported by the iCalendar VFREEBUSY object type.
The object type is used by Google Apps calendars where the organisation has prohibited the public disclosure of event information.
Team Calendars should support the VFREEBUSY object type in import files and also in the subscriptions.
